millsfield:images_texts:
THE SATURDAY EVENING POST
JANUARY
The blue Caribbean is studded with beautiful, sun-warmed beaches
similar to the one (shown above) at Montego Bay, Jamaica.
The calendar says January...
but in the West Indies it's June
and by Flying Clipper &
→ you get there in only a few hours!
San Juan, Hub of the Caribbean, is
now only 9 hours from New York..
Cuba only 80 minutes from Miami
... Jamaica only 3 hours and 15 min-
utes from Miami. As a matter of fact,
the West Indies are less than a day
from any point in the U.S. A.!
See your Travel Agent or the near-
est Pan American office for rates and
reservations not only to the West
Indies, but also to Mexico, Central
and South America,
Europe,
the
Near East, India, Africa, Alaska,
Hawaii, New Zealand, Australia,
the Orient and around the world.
Paradise Beach, at Nassau in the Bahamas, is just what its name implies! … Beautiful,
restill….
. Nassau is only 75 minutes by Flying Clipper from Miami ... Daily service ...
Note that, except for a very few cases, U.S. Citizens need no passport for any island in
the Bahamas or West Indies. Your Travel Agent or Pan American has all the details.
UNITED STATES
LOS ANGELES
"One of the greatest bastions of the Western
world is the wav spain's massive Torancatons
at San Juan, Puerto Rico, were described in the
days or ine buccancels a
.. You can walk beside
them this winter in warm tropical sunshine.

properties.sfomuseum:description: Advertisement from January 17, 1947 issue of Saturday Evening Post promoting Pan American World Airways, titled “The calendar says January but in the West Indies it’s June...”; color photographic image of beach scenes at Montego Bay, Jamaica, Nassau and San Juan, Puerto Rico with black and white calendar of January with image of people in rain, holding umbrellas.
properties.sfomuseum:subject: Pan Am promotional advertisement
